inn1.comm: bit of a loosener from Bresnan, dragged down a bit, but Kamran too is not quite at his sharpest and toe-ends a cut to cover
better line and length from Bresnan and Kamran defends
Bresnan loses his line and shoves it down the leg side, Kamran misses his leg-side tickle but it flicks the pad and runs away for a couple
much better delivery and Kamran calmly defends to point
ooh, good ball this time, jagging away past the dangling outside edge
top response! This is what he's done so well all series - calmly stroking the ball at the top of its bounce through the covers for an early boundary
good start from Anderson, finding the inbetween length where Hafeez is unsure whether to get forward or back and it runs off the outside edge down to third man
arrow-straight again and Kamran defends
ideal delivery, just hanging outside off stump and dragging Kamran reluctantly forward, whispers past the edge
slightly leg-sided from Anderson and clipped away to midwicket
Anderson is just focusing on line and length, he knows it's no day for trying anything too fancy, Hafeez reaches for the textbook and defends perfectly
Anderson strikes! What a delivery it was too! Fullish, pitching and jagging away sharply to turn Hafeez around, squaring him up, clipping a fine outside edge and Davies holds on!
good work from Bresnan, not offering any width for Kamran to work with and it's carefully defended
sturdy defence from Kamran once more
Bresnan finds the off-stump line and good length again, carefully defended

Kamran falls this time! Big breakthrough and Kamran is unlucky to go. Shades of Michael Vaughan's Trent Bridge dismissal against India in 2008 - nothing delivery down the leg side, clips the thigh pad and deflects on to leg stump.
gets a good ball first up, Bresnan jumping wide of the crease, angling it in before moving it away off the seam
good finish to an excellent over, Yousuf defending carefully into the leg side
Shafiq has looked good this series and starts by opening the face and gliding down to third man
Anderson angles this in and Yousuf prods towards midwicket
Yousuf misses out here, Anderson drifts on to the legs but Yousuf's routine nurdle is missed
little bit short and a little bit wide, Yousuf eases a cut shot airily to third man
good work from Anderson, trying nothing more that aiming for the top of off and it's blocked
flash and miss to finish! Touch of extra bounce clears the cut shot and Davies collects
short ball from Bresnan, not overly sharp but Yousuf jerks his head out of the line rather dramatically
good ball this, splice-hitting heavy ball that Yousuf defends in a hurry
another leg-side delivery is missed by Yousuf and the dots are adding up quickly here
Bresnan goes fuller this time and Yousuf defends very correctly
finally Yousuf connects with a delivery on the pads, picking it off past square leg for a much-needed couple
nicely played here, Yousuf watches it carefully on to the bat, opens the face and sends it down to third man to keep the strike
nicely timed down the ground by Yousuf but straight to Luke Wright at mid-on
good delivery this, seaming back in and bouncing into Yousuf's midriff, sharp delivery from Anderson
little bit too short this time and Yousuf gets to chop down to third man
no mistakes from England in the field yet as Shafiq pushes the ball firmly to point
back of a length and arrow-straight once more, nothing Shafiq can do but defend
another good over passes and Pakistan are getting stuck
nicely played by Yousuf, walking across his stumps and pushing the ball very securely wide of mid-on for a single
angled into the pads from Bresnan but Shafiq can't work it away
prodded into the off side, Shafiq wants a single but there really isn't one available
lovely shot this time, very neatly played, Shafiq leaning on a leg-side clip that he times very sweetly through straight midwicket for a boundary
back on the defence this time
Bresnan offers a hint of width but the cut shot is bottom edged and dribbles into the off side
cracking shot this! Languid back-foot drive square of the wicket on the off side, punching it at the top of the bounce and sending if hurrying to the boundary
this time it's worked away with all the timing and elegance of Yousuf of old, beating mid-on and sending Wright bounding after it
good work from Shafiq, dropping it into the off side and scampering through for a single
nothing Yousuf can do here other than defend a straight, length ball from Anderson
another single for Yousuf, picking this off his hip into the leg side
Shafiq drives very confidently but straight to point
good start from Broad, finding an off-stump line straight away but Yousuf drops it by his feet and sets off for one
Shafiq plays the ball with very firm hands, which means no single for him when he blocks into the off side
wow, top running from Mohammad Yousuf, of all people, Shafiq bottom edges by his feet and Yousuf teared up the other end
dropped to point and Yousuf is off again, he'll be exhausted at this rate!
good ball here, on off stump, sharp and Shafiq blocks
carefully defended to finish a good first over from Broad

Anderson strikes again! Nip-backer does for Yousuf! The batsman was unhappy but replays show it clipping the bails. He walked across his stumps looking initially to run it down to third man but it jagged back and Yousuf couldn't get his bat down in time. Top bowling from Anderson!
there is an air of Simon Katich in the way Alam starts outside leg and crabs across to off stump to defend here
defended quietly once more
Alam shuffles across to off stump, defends solidly
this time Alam leaves alone with a real relish outside off
oooh, beaten outside off, Alam feels for this but it zips past the egde
Broad charges in and lands this one on a testing length on off stump, but Shafiq is nicely in line to defend
tapped into the off side, there was never a single there but Shafiq asks all the same
shout for lbw as the ball seams in and thumps into Shafiq's front pad, but it was a half-hearted appeal and that was heading well down the leg side
nudged into the leg side, and they take a single
another quick single as Alam flicks this just wide of midwicket, good running by these two
third sharp single of the over, and the umpire asks for a replay as a direct hit crashes into the stumps at the non-striker's end... but Shafiq is easily home
full and slanting towards leg stump, Shafiq aims a wristy clip into the leg side but the ball goes nowhere
width offered outside off, and Shafiq cuts late down to third man
good line from Anderson, on or around off stump, and Alam reaches out and defends to cover
that has seamed! Alam is squared up as Anderson lands one on middle and off and jags it towards the slips. The ball squirts off the outside edge and flies down to third man
watchful defence into the off side
a touch too straight from Anderson, and he's nudged to short fine leg for one
chopped down to backward point
deliberately steered wide of slip! Well-played by Shafiq, he angled the bat to get it down there and though it wasn't far from slip it bounced well infront of him. Valuable runs
and he follows that up with a tip-and-run into the leg side
awkward defensive push from Alam, slicing across the ball and taking the bottom hand off the bat. But no harm done
punched defensively to extra cover off the back foot

overthrows! Broad isn't happy, and hocks a gob onto the turf to show his disdain. Alam nudged into the leg side and charged through for a quick single, a throw was fired at the non-striker's end and struck him on the ankle as he scampered for the crease, rolling away for four
not much turn, yet, as Alam defends to leg
slightly fuller, but straight again and defended back down the track
tossed up a bit slower, nudged to cover
just a touch too short from Swann, and Alam cuts hard out to the cover sweeper
full outside off, driven hard but straight to extra cover
a hint of turn in to the right-hander, and he's turned round the corner for a quick single
tapped out to deep square leg, and they ease through for one to bring up Pakistan's fifty

shuffling defence to mid-off. Sahil has just pointed out, and I must say I agree, that there's a hint of Simon Katich about Alam. Taking guard well outside leg, the shuffle to off, the strong bottom hand...
length delivery on middle, nudged defensively to midwicket
seaming past the outside edge! Well bowled by Broad, landing the ball on just the right spot and getting it to seam away from Alam. No luck though
more length from Broad, and fidgety defence from Alam
has this kept a touch low? Awkward defensive push from Alam, falling over to off but managing to jab the bat down just in time
punched down to long-on for an easy single
Alam plays for non-existent turn, the ball takes the inside edge and ricochets off the pad
speared at leg stump from round the wicket, clipped to square leg
Swann has actually turned a couple to Shafiq, but it's nothing extravagant and he's glanced to short fine leg
wristily flicked, but straight to midwicket
tapped into space at square leg, and they steal a run
drilled hard to mid-off off the back foot
drop-and-run from Alam, good running
Broad is maintaing a disciplined line and length here, and Shafiq responds with solid defence
same again, and Shafiq doesn't try anything cute
Shafiq stays slightly leg side of the ball this time, looking to open up the off side, but Broad follows him... glanced to fine leg
hurried defence from Alam, no run taken
loosener from Wright, but it's well-directed - full and straight - and Shafiq punches to mid-on
now that's a touch too straight, and Shafiq flicks elegantly out to deep midwicket for a couple
full and straight again - Wright certainly seems to want to attack the stumps here. Shafiq drives hard back to the bowler, who gets a hand to it and deflects the ball to mid-off
full on off stump, watchfully driven to extra cover
shot from Alam! Driven straight, beating a diving Jimmy Anderson at mid-off, and racing away to the boundary. All timing on the shot, nothing brutish about it
full outside off, this time Alam has a full-blooded go at it but loses his shape at the crease and an ugly looking drive - especially in comparison to what came before it - goes straight to mid-off
tucked between midwicket and mid-on, and they take a quick single as Yardy charges round
very full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
driven back at Broad, who picks the ball up in his follow-through and threatens to throw the stumps down, sending Alam scampering back to the crease
length, pushed watchfully to cover point
first real mistake from Broad today as he spears this down the leg side
driven straight again, not with quite the same timing, and Swann and Yardy combine to cut it off
short and rising from Broad! Shafiq wasn't expecting that, and takes his eyes off the ball and raises his hands as protection. They pick up a single as the ball rolls to leg
big shout for lbw! That looked mighty close, but Doctrove says no ... may have been slipping down the leg side. Well, replays suggest that would've clipped leg stump, so Shafiq is a tad lucky there
thrashed uppishly, but wide of the cover fielders and away for four! Aggressive intent from Shafiq, he didn't hold back on the drive and though that was catchable the placement was good
hurled down the leg side, that's a wide
four more, but a classical drive this time! A nice checked-drive, on the up, that pings out of the middle and races away. Top shot
glanced down to fine leg for one
tight line on off stump, Alam defends to cover
Alam hangs deep in the crease and punches down to long-off for one
ideal from Alam, dabbing into the leg side and hurrying off for one
Shafiq has played nicely here and skips down the wicket to bunt a single down the ground to bring the 50 partnership from 67 balls
another good single taken by Alam, working the ball gently round the corner
faintest hint of a mix-up and England are sharp, Shafiq dropped the ball to short third man and set off for one before being sent back, the throw came in a hurry to lucky they didn't try and take one
this time a single is taken, worked around the corner for a gentle since
slightly short to finish off, Alam rocks back and cuts to deep point for one
starts very straight from over the wicket and Alam dabs to short third man for a swift single
good delivery here, slung in from around the wicket quickly and Shafiq blocks
slightly slower this time and defended to point
bit of spin here and Shafiq flicks it towards midwicket
Alam plays very crisply to cover
hint of width and Alam chops it firmly down to deep cover to keep the strike
nicely bowled by Swann, pushed into the left hander who defends
fuller from Swann and not giving Alam any room, carefully defended
strangled shout from Swann as Alam squeezes this between bat and pad into the off side for a single
Shafiq skips down the wicket but only to prod gently back to Swann
once again Shafiq looks for something expansive initially before changing his mind and pushing quietly back to the bowler
reverse-dab attempted, and not pulled off with any great power, with short third man in place it's not a great shot anyway
Alam gives himself room and gets deep into his crease to cut for a single
Shafiq picks the gap to long-off and collects a single with a drive
slightly overpitched and Alam slices a square-drive away for a couple
once again Alam is on the cut, playing it well but straight to the man at point
Alam works this down the ground, Yardy lunges at it but is nowhere near cutting it off, allowing another milked single
Shafiq shuffles outside leg but Yardy follows him and it's picked off into the leg side for one
Swann tosses this up but the languid drive is played very securely

gone this time! Tossed up again by Swann but Shafiq couldn't resist going for the big drive. He skipped down the wicket without quite reaching it and ended up lifting it with no great power or timing straight to Eoin Morgan who was in from the long-off boundary. Smart bowling and it brings an end to a very promising innings
pity, that partnership was looking rather good, Alam here glides a single to third man
Umar flicks his first ball round the corner to short fine leg
nicely played here, flicked powerfully to long-on all along the ground
Alam can't get this away, instead poking back to Swann
Yardy fires in a quickish yorker that Umar jabs back to him
Umar is wearing his ludicrous luminous green lipstick, you'll all be pleased to know, and he's also blocking this to point
carefully defended once more
good bowling from Yardy here, choking Umar for space and he defends
Umar down on one knee and dabbing an awkward sweep shot over his shoulder for one
Alam works down the ground for a strike-stealing single
good bowling from Swann, Alam was looking to dab a single but the line was too straight
Alam this time takes a single, pushing to long-off to bring up the Pakistan 100
Umar steers this square of the wicket on the off side for a couple
touch short but the ball kept very low, Umar was looking for an expansive cut but couldn't time it
better shot this time, Umar pulling in front of midwicket for a single
tossed up slower and higher from Swann, Alam tries to work a single down the ground but can't beat mid-on
Umar tickles a full toss round to fine leg to collect one
singles being taken quite regularly, but Pakistan need plenty more
touch of extra bounce and spin here from Yardy which meant Umar's cut shot was mistimed to point
thrown up a bit higher from Yardy and it's worked down the ground for a single
Umar is content to take singles for a while, and here he dabs a full toss to cover for a single
poor delivery punished! Touch too short and wide and Alam's cut shot beats the infield and races to the point boundary
Swann trying to tempt Umar with some air, but Umar works it all along the ground to deep midwicket
stroked carefully to deep point for another single
Umar looks to be enjoying his singles show, setting very early to push into the off side before scampering off for one
Alam this time takes the single and Pakistan are milking very effectively here
this burrows through quite low and Umar gets it off the outer-half of the bat, past the keeper for a swift couple
firm cut shot to finish another good over for Pakistan
good start from the big man, finding an off-stump line that Umar pushes quietly into the off side
banged in shorter, Umar leaps and guides very neatly to third man for a single
big mix up as Umar calls for a single, he's half way down before being sent back but Anderson at short third man makes a hash of it. Rare mistake from Anderson
this time there is a single, worked into space for one

oh dear, awful shot. Banged in short and Umar raced down the wicket and tried to hook this out the ground, got cramped as he tried to play the shot, ended up top-edging straight to fine leg. Good work from Bresnan, that's why he was the one to watch!
very carefully defended first up by Afridi
tapped into the off side for a quick single
nudged to square leg by Afridi, another single the result
punched out to cover point
BoomBoom charges out of his crease and absolutely hammers this down to long-off. Hit very hard, but along the ground
Alam looks to steal a single into the off side, wisely sent back by Afridi
slapped out into the covers, and they ease through for one
on a length with a hint of width outside off, chopped down to backward point
cut away behind square, Wright does well charging round the boundary and sliding to cut the ball off near the rope
pushed back to the bowler
short, Alam hooks somewhat wildly as the ball rises up at his grille but he keeps his eye on the ball and rolls his wrists to keep it down

rifling pull to straight midwicket! Strauss got a hand to it at midwicket but that's hurt him on this chilly day and though he took some pace off the ball it still had enough on it to get it to the boundary
seaming in considerably off the pitch, Afridi defends back to the bowler
flighted outside off, driven down to long-off
tight stuff from Yardy, coming round the wicket to Afridi and cramping him for room
another dot as Afridi can't get this one away
Afridi gives himself acres of room and carves into the covers, well-stopped
edged! But there's no slip! Short third man does well to slide across and get a hand on the ball, saved two runs there
drilled back to the bowler, end of a good over from Yardy
whipped of the hip down to fine leg
good yorker from Bresnan! It was outside off and slipped under the bat as Afridi tried to drive through the off side
delicately played! Slower ball from Bresnan and Afridi picked it up, waiting on the ball and guiding it down to third man
short and wide outside off, wild slash from Afridi but he doesn't get close. He's missed out there
angling in towards leg stump off the seam, dropped towards square leg for a single
landing on a length on leg stump, glanced to fine leg

full toss from Yardy, Alam looks to the make the most of hit as he swings it hard into the leg side... Wright does superbly well on the boundary once again, sliding to cut it off, getting up and diving again as the ball rolled away from him. Fifty for Alam
clipped to short fine leg for one
full, straight and fast. Alam leans forward and defends to off
inside edge on the cut! The ball ricochets off the boot and they steal a quick single. Hands on head for Yardy, that could easily have been played on
speared in flat and fast on off stump, nudged out to deep cover point
Alam gives himself some room and punches out to deep cover
tossed up on middle, it was very full and Alam dug it out to midwicket ... they could have pushed for two there, but Afridi opts for safety and turns it down
Afridi gets his left leg right across to the off side and sweeps to long leg, there's the 150 for Pakistan
Alam does well here, stepping forward but he doesn't quite get to the pitch. Does enough to send the ball out to cover for one
hammered! BoomBoom is finding himself again, slowly. He charges down the track and drills this back over Swann's head. Both the bowler and the umpire took evasive action there!
tapped through point ... and an over-excited Bresnan gives away an overthrow with a wild shy at the stumps! Swann is spitting nails
glanced to fine leg, calm stuff from Afridi
Afridi makes some room and punches to cover
driven to long-off, and they amble through for one
Alam is sent diving back to his crease! That could've been very tight, he tapped into the covers and there was indecision as both batsmen started to run and then stopped... back in time though
full, driven back to the bowler
Alam aims a controlled chip out to deep midwicket, and picks up two runs for his efforts
shot! Alam gives himself a bit of room as Yardy hurls one down at medium-pace, scything a cut to the boundary behind square
Afridi's first six of the series! He comes down the wicket, getting right to the pitch and follows through with a savage lofted drive to send the ball sailing over long-on
good batting from Afridi, hangs back in the crease and places this behind square on the leg side for two
very full, the ball comes off the bat/pad and rolls into the covers
driven down to long-on for one
spinning in towards leg stump, Afridi looks to get this past short fine leg but can't beat the fielder
punched through extra cover! Afridi gives himself some room, and punches hard through cover to pick up four more. Great placement on the shot, and didn't try to whack it too hard
chipped just wide of a diving midwicket fielder! Beats him though, and Alam picks up two more

chipped again, but out this time! Yardy held this one back a bit, Alam tried to drive through the off side but drove it uppishly and straight to Strauss who stuck his hands up above his head to snatch the ball out of the air
Razzaq is off the mark straight away, nudging to fine leg
driven out to deep cover
tap-and-run and a quick single into the covers
driven back hard to the bowler

full on the pads, inside edge onto the front leg and they take a single ... Now what has happened here? A throw was fired in, came off Afridi's bat, which was left raised and this looks out! He's gone, run out. Tragedy for Pakistan. Afridi was actually easily home but he didn't ground his bat. Another wicket falls, and they're struggling now
chopped down to backward point
back of a length on middle, defended back down the track
slower ball, legcutter. Razzaq didn't pick it at first, but had time to re-adjust and dab it down to third man
full on middle, tapped defensively to midwicket
nothing remotely pretty here, shoved down the leg side for a wide
much better this time, on off stump and defended
Razzaq takes a single, worked into space in the off side
Gul defends his first delivery from Anderson very correctly
good bowling from Anderson, giving no room for Gul and it's defended with the straightest of blades
poor running again as Gul guides to point, sets off for a single, decides against it, thinks about changing his mind again, before finally deciding not to
this is the sort of shot he's played well all summer, clipping with surprisingly good timing through to deep midwicket
very wide from Broad, shoved well down the leg side
fuller and straighter from Broad and very correctly defended
Gul looks actually quite comfortable at the crease, but he can't take any risks at this stage
just a fraction short and Gul is up on one leg, swivelling a pull shot around the corner
Broad gets away with one here! Half-tracker wide of off, Razzaq should have clattered it but couldn't connect
connected with this one though! Goodness me he's thrashed this over midwicket. Slower-ball bouncer from Broad and straight into Razzaq's hitting arc
well the one shot made it a good over for Pakistan as Razzaq defends to finish off
slower ball from Anderson to begin with which Gul pats gently back
short and wide but Gul misses the attempted cut shot
another slash outside off stump and another miss
beaten again! Offcutter from Anderson and Gul's misses a routine defence
Gul manages to get bat on ball here, but only to defend
maiden over! Slower-ball yorker to finish off and Gul is in Test-match mode
Bresnan offers some width outside off stump that Razzaq carts through point
deary me, Gul can't do anything with these slower balls at the moment, his misses a swipe outside off
finally Gul finds a single, pushing to deepish mid-off
this is an excellent shot from Razzaq, he's having no trouble against these slower balls, gets into position early before picking the gap past short fine leg with a very neat paddle

poor delivery this time, sprayed down leg and Razzaq clips it past that short fine keg fielder again for what could have been a boundary if it were not for an excellent sprawling save by the smiling Shahzad
Bresnan has the full tea pot on show, unimpressed with being wided, it was rather wide of off
Gul misses yet another slower ball outside off stump
good bowling from Anderson, giving Razzaq no width and a bottom-edge bounces through to Davies
Razzaq opens to the face to run down to third man where Luke Wright bounds across the field and fires in a return
Gul connects outside off! It's enough to earn him a single to third man and a cheer from the crowd
touch fuller from Anderson and Razzaq drives powerfully out to deep cover
slower ball again outside off and Gul's mistimed cut finds point
very good fielding from Wright keeps this outside edge to a single
very smart save down the leg side from Davies saves a boundary as Bresnan strays down the leg side.
good delivery here, fuller and straight and Razzaq jabs a defence
driven firmly down the ground where Luke Wright runs around from long-on and fields
shorter ball is swung away to deep midwicket for a single
Razzaq tries to clear his front leg and smack this into the leg side but the length is too full and Razzaq only manages a single to long-on
slower ball that Gul pushes very gently past the bowler for another single
oops, Bresnan gets this all wrong as he fires this well down the leg side
shot! That makes it a good over! Razzaq clears his front leg and Bresnan's length was just of a yorker, punished as Razzaq smashes over mid-off for four
Gul collects a single by running this straight to short third man

too full from Broad, full toss and Razzaq clears his front leg as usual and swing this over cover for four, timed it very sweetly to bring up the highest eighth-wicket stand for Pakistan against England
all over now! Razzaq departs smashing a slower-ball bouncer out to Anderson at cow corner, who dives forward to collect smartly
Saeed Ajmal pokes this into the off side and runs through for a single
touch too short from Broad and Gul is a fine puller! Smacking this with excellent timing to the square leg boundary! Can Pakistan reach 250?
slower-ball and short outside off, Gul flays at it and doesn't time it well, sending it one-bounce to cover
starts with an offcutter that's worked to Strauss at square leg for a lung-busting single
dropped by Bopara! Gul sliced a drive in the air to point but Bopara was on his heels and had to dive forward but he couldn't hold on
this is out though! Very out indeed! Full and straight, Ajmal plays all around it and it struck bang in front. Three wickets for Anderson, he's bowled excellently today
inswinging yorker first up to Shoaib, who never looked like getting bat on ball and it thuds into the pads
another big inswinger, Shoaib clipped it to square leg and set off for a single that was never there, before changing his mind and getting back, eventually
excellent end to an excellent spell from Anderson, swinging a yorker into Shoaib who jabs it out into the off side
Gul gives himself a bit of room and Broad follows him, in the end it's clipped to midwicket to bring Shoaib back on strike
full toss that Shoaib times very studiously into the cover for one
great take from Davies, Gul wandering outside leg stump and tries to flap this to leg, comes off the pads and Davies was wrong-footed at his collected
good yorker this, fired full and straight and Gul can do nothing but defend
Gul again walks outside leg stump but this time Broad goes full outside off, and Gul can't reach it
another yorker which Gul can't connect with and that finishes Broad's spell
perfect shot in these circumstances, thick inside edge runs past the keeper for a boundary. Shoaib flying now!
Shoaib tried to smash this miles over cover, but a touch of reverse-swing made sure he couldn't connect
pretty ugly flap into the off side, no timing at all but it gets Shoaib a single
all over now. Slower ball, Gul down on one knee trying to dink a sweep shot, but he misses and it crashes into middle stump.

inn2.comm: pacy loosener from Shoaib! He finds the inside edge of Strauss's bat, but the ball rolls safely to fine leg
spitting off a length, beating the outside edge of Davies' flat-footed push and bursting out of Kamran's gloves! That really took off
quick, on a length, and nudged carefully to midwicket
slashed away square for four! Shoaib pushed this well wide of off stump and Davies' eyes lit up. He hit it in the air but very hard and over backward point
this is an even better drive from Davies! Shoaib pitched it up again, closer to off stump, and Davies leaned into a powerful cover drive. A controlled shot
back of a length on off stump, punched to point
gentle pace to start with, but on target and Strauss digs a straight yorker out to mid-off
off the outside edge! But flying well wide of the slips and down to third man. That was full and wide and Strauss went for the drive, but a bit of seam movement meant the ball took a thick edge
Razzaq cuts him in half! That hit the seam again, but went the other way, jagging back in to Davies to beat the inside edge. That was very close to the stumps!
great start from Razzaq, beating the outside edge of Davies' defensive poke now
flicked off the hip out into the leg side
width offered outside off, but Davies doesn't look to do anything too wild, tapping to backward point
angled across Strauss, who has a look and leaves well alone
bursting past the outside edge! Perfect line from Shoaib, pitching on middle and off and angling away. A fraction fuller and he may have found the edge
attempted bouncer, and Strauss dismisses it from his presence with a one-legged pull tp midwicket! Well infront of square
Shoaib goes fuller and finds a hint of seam movement, the ball takes the inside edge and ricochets into the pad
quickest ball of the match! Strauss is struck on the pad but that pitched outside leg and may well have missed leg too
Shoaib goes for the quick leg-stump delivery again but this time Strauss meets the ball with a controlled leg glance to pick up four to square leg
glanced off middle and leg down to fine leg
Strauss inside edges again into the pad, this time he was forward and looking to drive through cover
on a length and wide of off, but Strauss opts for caution and leaves alone
crashed through the covers! A flowing backfoot drive from Strauss as Razzaq gives him room once again, and he placed it perfectly
Razzaq goes fuller and straighter and is clipped to midwicket
on a length and straight, Davies gets nicely in line and defends to mid-off
tight line from Shoaib, and Strauss defends to cover
pushed through just outside off, and left alone by Strauss. Shoaib's run-up is still slightly rickety but he's working up some good pace here
full, jagging away towards the slips off the seam and Straus is squared up but defends to cover
punched hard into the covers off the back foot
full on off stump, Strauss taps just to the left of Yousuf at mid-on and charges through for a quick single. The shy is wide, but it's Yousuf so the run was always on
flicked uppishly but into space towards fine leg
Davies walks down the track at Razzaq and bunts through midwicket for a couple
misdirected down the leg side, and Razzaq will have to bowl that one again

Razzaq has no great pace but he's gamely plugging away on off stump here (mostly). Again Davies is beaten on the inside edge as he aims a lazy looking drive towards mid-off. The luck not with Pakistan today though
tapped to cover off the back foot
slower-ball bouncer, but that's very slow indeed and easily spotted by Davies, who thumps a pull up and over midwicket. Too easy
another slightly sloppy drive from Davies, and he's beaten on the outside edge. Didn't get near it

Davies' stumps are shattered! Razzaq nips another one back in off the seam, Davies leaves a huge gap between bat and pad as he swishes, crease-bound, and has his off stump pegged back. First strike for Pakistan!
Shoaib comes round the wicket to Strauss, but the ball pitches well wide of off and Strauss shoulders arms
identical ball, and the response from Strauss is the same too: no shot offered
back of a length and angling in, Strauss stays deep in the crease and punches to mid-on
fired full and at the pads, but Strauss likes them there and nudges through midwicket for a couple
much tighter on off stump this time, and Strauss defends under his eyes
but Strauss still manages to pick the gap and picks up a single to square leg
full and wide of off, Strauss bottom-edges the slash and the ball bounces down to third man
full and just outside off, Trott leans forward and drives his first ball carefully to mid-off
seaming away slightly after pitching on a length, but Trott keeps a close eye on it and defends to off
nudged defensively to midwicket this time. Razzaq keeping things nice and tight to Trott. "Nagging" is the word Rameez Raja has just used, and it's spot on
slightly fuller on off stump, and Trott pats it into the covers
nudged just wide of mid-on, and Trott is off the mark with a scampered single
short on off stump, Trott swivels quickly into a pull but the ball rushes on to him and he can only hit it as far as short fine leg
nipping in appreciably off the seam, but that starts on middle and leg and goes further in that direction, and Trott is in no trouble flicking this down to fine leg
glanced out to deep square for a single as Shoaib stays round the wicket to Strauss
a touch of wobble through the air for Shoaib there, and Trott defends into the leg side
full, there to be driven, but Trott is late on the drive and the ball trickles to mid-off

what a ball! Unplayable yorker! Shoaib found a hint of inswing earlier in this over, and this has swung and dipped under Trott's bat, clattering into the stumps. Inswinging yorker at round about 90mph, and Trott departs! Shoaib's still got it...
angling across Strauss on a length, he has a good look and leaves that alone
Strauss drives into the covers, faintly ridiculous fielding by Afridi and Ajmal, as they both go for the ball but it nips right between them...
full on off stump, Bopara drives to cover
Bopara nudges to Ajmal, who fumbles, and he's off the mark. Afridi has a stern look at his errant fielder
that wasn't short by any means but Strauss picked up the length in a flash, and whipped a bottom-handed pull to square leg. England's fifty is up

Afridi shows his fielders how to do it... almost ... Strauss punched to cover and looked to have found the gap, but Afridi charged round and cut the shot off. But then hurled in a wild throw at Kamran's toes to give away an overthrow
full and straight from Shoaib, what a delivery that yorker to dismiss Trott was, rolled back the years! This is stroked away for a couple
good line here from around the wicket and Strauss can do little but defend
imperious shot this from Strauss, stepping forward and driving handsomely through the line, sending it to extra cover boundary in a flash
this time Strauss works with the angle round to midwicket where Afridi collects and hurls it at the non-striker's end
top fielding from Umar here, Strauss clipped towards deep square thinking he's get two but Umar was round in a flash
lovely shot for none! Drilled back but straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end
dishes up a leg-stump half-volley first up that Strauss clips firmly, just wide of Mohammad Yousuf at mid-on who escorts the ball all the way to the rope, never looked like reaching it
much better ball this time, around off stump moving away in the air, finds a thickish outside edge to third man
good delivery to Bopara here, rising around off stump, he stands tall to defend
back of a length again, Bopara very calmly defends and then heads down the pitch for a chat with his captain
wristy cut finds point, who misfields and gifts a single
poor delivery expertly played, with fine leg up Gul lands it a touch short and on the pads, Strauss clips it past the fielder and collects another boundary
sharpish ball thuds into Bopara's pads and dribbles into the leg side, Strauss calls through a quick single
fired into the pads but it beats Strauss and again runs off the thigh pad for a single
Bopara leans into a confident-looking drive, but straight to mid-off
this almost got through! Full and straight and Bopara only managed a faint inside edge - enough to save him but very close
nervy again from Bopara! Hanging his bat away from body outside off and it came off an inside edge on to boot, so easily could have gone on to the stumps

without quite timing this perfectly, Bopara has collected a boundary driving to extra cover where Umar Akmal ran after it, slid to stop but missed and had to slide again from the boundary, but was touching the ball while over the rope
Strauss cautiously nudges into the leg side and scampers a single
confident, crisp drive first up from Bopara, straight to cover
this time he gets back and picks out cover with a drive
eased down the ground for a single
Strauss pushes back to the bowler, who makes a hash of the save, palming wide of mid-off and allowing a single
Bopara departs! Ajmal is a dangerous bowler and Bopara flashed an off drive, but could only get a faint edge through to Kamran Akmal, who held on gleefully!
Shoaib striving and sweating buckets for his team here, angles one into Strauss who clips into the leg side for a single
good first ball to the new batsman, bang on a length and line and Morgan defends
big wind up from Shoaib, and arrows in a fullish ball that Morgan blocks to cover and scampers through for one
Strauss very carefully defending here, probably knows Shoaib hasn't got much left after this
big grunt from Shoaib as he tries to spear in a yorker, the length isn't quite right and Strauss punches to mid-on
not so much a grunt as a primal scream from Shoaib in delivery here, full-toss too after all that which Morgan bunts casually to mid-on
tossed up and driven to short extra
this just cramped Strauss as he tried to cut, in the end played it calmly enough but straight to cover
good tight bowling from Ajmal, nothing Strauss can do but defend
50 from Strauss, his 23rd and it comes off 48 balls, he's in fine ODI form this summer and gets there with a back-foot punch to deep point
Morgan down very early to dab a sweep shot, plays it well and fine, collecting a couple
good delivery outside off stump that Morgan strokes quietly down the wicket, just about beating the bowler and collecting a single to take him to drinks
starts with a length ball outside off stump that Morgan defends
touch short and Morgan pulls without the best timing, dragging it to deep midwicket for a single
neatly clipped off the pads to midwicket for a single
a touch too short from Gul and Morgan chops a cut shot very firmly to point
Morgan again picks out the point fielder, this time with a defensive block
pretty shoddy delivery, dragged down short and wide, Morgan slapped a cut shot straight to deep point
stroked down to long-on for a single
Strauss rocks back to cut to deep cover
Morgan cautiously defend and it runs off the inside edge for a single
ooh, this finds an inside edge of Strauss's bat and dribbles into the leg side
much more secure from Strauss this time, pushed firmly to long-off
doosra to finish up, Morgan doesn't read it and it spins into his pad
Gul gets his line wrong, landing it on Strauss's pads and tickled down to the fine leg boundary
gone, Gul strikes and what a strike! Full and nips back, gets the inside edge and clatters into off stump! Strauss departs and England in trouble now!
wow, this pitches and really zips off the wicket, leaving Yardy and beating the outside edge by a distance
and again! Fuller this time, Yardy prods at it nervously and it whistles past the edge

Kamran Akmal drops it! Calamity Kamran strikes again! Gul finds a thickish outside edge that goes low and wide to Kamran, diving one-handed to his left and he couldn't quite hold on. Looks to have damaged his finger as well
very good end to the over from Gul, he's a man transformed with that wicket! Morgan defends very carefully, he has a massive task on his hands
tidy delivery first up that is guided to short third man for a swift single
beaten outside off stump, this moves away a fraction off the wicket and ghosts past the edge
definite movement out there, Morgan having to be very watchful in defence
very nicely timed through cover here, not an expansive follow through, just a punch from Morgan
Morgan drops this into the off side and sets off for a tight single
pushed out to deep point for another single
again past the outside edge! This ball is certainly nipping around under the lights, but Yardy manages to keep the bat inside the line
squirting off the outside half of the bat towards third man. It was edgier than he wanted, but he was trying to angle it down in that direction
punched towards mid-on - who is surely too deep - and Morgan calls Yardy through for a quick single
well, after a bit of a wild and wooly start Gul is seemingly beating the outside edge almost at will now. Again, Yardy keeps the bat inside the line though

that's out! Gul nips one back in to Yardy's pads to strike him dead infront of his stumps. That looked plumb the moment it hit him, and Gul is celebrating again! Pakistan are edging ahead in this contest now, but as has happened so often recently Morgan's wicket is the key
a brave leave! Wright raises the bat above his head but that seamed in after pitching and wasn't too far from the off stump...
a touch of turn there, it was the legspinner and spun back in to Morgan, who punched straight to the man at cover
this time the ball rushes straight on, and Morgan dispatches a cut to backward point!
inside edge to fine leg! But he's safe

was there an edge on that? Morgan bent down into the reverse sweep but the ball was wide of off and he had to reach for it... Kamran fumbles what was, to be fair, an almost impossible take so it doesn't make much of a difference in the end
crunched over midwicket! That wasn't too short but Morgan picked up the length early and swatted him over the leg side. Great shot under pressure, and Morgan leads England's counterattack
nudged defensively to midwicket
full, fast and swinging away. Wright stretches into a square drive but point does well to tumble to his right and cut that off. Not the most elegant fielding, but effective
sharp yorker! That could so easily have snuck through, but Morgan jabbed the bat down in time
back of a length and angling towards the slips, Morgan hops back and defends to point
another length delivery angling across him, this one is slightly wider and Morgan leaves alone
that wobbled back in through the air! But Morgan's got a good eye and adjusts to defend under his eyes
full and wide, Morgan slices a square drive down to third man where the fielder slides to cut it off
where is the slip? No close catcher for the new batsman, and this flies off the edge of a defensive push! That would have landed in slip's lap... instead, it's a single
off the inside edge to midwicket, plenty of encouragement from Kamran
solid defence from Morgan, stretching forward
paddywhack! Morgan nails the reverse-sweep this time, racing to the third man boundary all along the ground. That was right out of the middle
a touch short, Morgan hops back and across and punches out to cover
off the pad and down to fine leg. There was a big appeal from Afridi, but that was very optimistic indeed. Missing leg, and possibly some bat involved too

a full-toss, hurled down the leg side and that beats Kamran and rolls to the boundary. It sounded as though Wright got something on that, but it's called wides. And Kamran, who hurt his finger attempting to take a catch a couple of overs ago is down and wringing his fingers again now. That's got to hurt!
back of a length, punched to cover
left alone outside off, Kamran takes it gingerly and flings the ball away like a hot potato
pushed gently towards cover, no chance for a quick single as there's a strong ring of fielders in the ring
well wide of off stump, Wright pushes at the ball a little half-heartedly and angles it down to gully
full of length on off stump, Wright lunges into a drive but doesn't strike it anywhere near the middle. But it's in the gap so that's one
the left/right combination is messing with Gul's radar, as he spears this one down the leg side. Would've been a testing ball to Wright!
that's nipped off the seam, beating the outside edge, but no harm done
nudged to midwicket
pushed straight to Ajmal at mid-on. Again, he is surely too deep. There should never have been a single there. And he fumbles, which doesn't help
chipped into the leg side, cries of "catch it!" from Pakistan but that falls safely
Wright looks to play off the back foot as Afridi gets one to rush on, inside edge
another appeal from Afridi as Wright is struck on the pad, but again that's slanting down
watchful defence from Morgan to finish the over
Gul has been consistently too far outside off to Wright, and now he's slapped away to deep cover
nice and straight to Morgan though, and Eoin defends to mid-on
on the spot again, good bowling from Gul, not giving Morgan any room on either side
no slip for Morgan as the ball flies off a thick edge. Actually, only a third slip would've had a chance there
full, wide half-volley and that's the first one Wright has middled tonight. Driven hard through cover, and he puts enough on it to beat the cover sweeper

has he got an inside ege there? Huge appeal from Gul as Wright is struck on the pad, and if he hasn't got a touch on that he's mighty lucky to still be there. The ball swung in through the air, landing on a length, and hit the front pad. HotSpot suggests a little inside edge, so a good decision

too short from Afridi, a bad ball and a good shot from Morgan. He stepped back and across and thumped it to cover. A quicker fielder could've cut that off, but Shoaib was creaking after it and didn't get close
nudged into the leg side by Morgan
quicker ball from Afridi, but it's arrowed down the leg side and Wright just needs to get a touch on it to pick up four
ugly swipe across the line from Wright, and the ball rolls to long-on
good rotation of the strike - as usual - from Morgan, and that's one more
solid defensive stroke from Wright to finish the over
the umpire calls dead ball as Morgan pats into the off side, waits, and then sets off as cover tosses it to the bowler. That won't count as a run
that will be one, tapped into the leg side
chopped down to third man, and that'll take England's score to 150
pushed through cover, the throw comes in from the fielder and hits the stumps with the batsman well home, there's a ricochet and they'll pick up overthrows
studied defence from Wright
too short outside off, and an easy single as Wright guides him down to third man
eased down to long-on
great shot from Morgan, he's got total confidence in his own skill and total freedom in his shots. It was pitched up and he just thumped it up and over cover
slashed away to backward point
full on off stump, drilled hard but straight into the hands of cover
Wright is beaten in the flight and struck on the front foot, but again that was angling well down the leg side
nudged carefully into the leg side
doosra first up gets the outside edge that passes a diving slip for a single
Morgan very watchful in defence
this is so well played, soft hands and picking a gap, tucking it into the midwicket region for a well-run two
now back on careful defence
sliced drive goes airily towards the point boundary for a single
fired full and wide down the leg side where Umar Akmal makes an athletic save, fine work!
gentle singe as Wright prods this into the off side
very ginger as he paces in, already sweating buckets, but the line is good and Wright pushes to cover for a single
not full pace as yet and Morgan comfortably forward to defend
good ball this time, bit of shape away in the air and Morgan defends carefully, time for Afridi to bring a slip in surely?
cracker, absolute beauty from Shoaib, swings away past Morgan's outside edge
slightly fuller from Shoaib, Morgan into line and punching a careful drive through extra cover for a couple

full and straight to finish the over, raps Morgan on the pads and trickles into the leg side, Wright calls for a single but Morgan has none of it. Time for a drink, hope it's a hot one because it's freezing out there
Wright tries to fiddle this to leg but misses
touch short from Ajmal here, Wright rocks back and cuts off the toe-end down to third man for a boundary
this clips the pad and dribbles to leg for a single
fifty for Morgan, his 10th, gets there by stroking through the covers
good save from slip, Ajmal found the outside edge and it went wide of slip who dived well to field
carefully defended to finish the over
short and a touch wide from Shoaib, Morgan cut firmly backwards if deep point for a couple more
touch of reverse swing away from Morgan, who gives it so much respect that he leaves alone
Morgan intent on seeing Shoaib off, defending very carefully around off stump
sharp yorker, really landed it perfectly and Morgan jabbed a bat down in time
driven very crisply to cover who fields smartly
Shoaib finishes a really high-class spell with a 90mph yorker that Morgan defends, excellent over and a really big effort from Shoaib

doosra beats Wright outside off and Umar Akmal whips off the bails, he's clearly enjoying himself, well, was Luke Wright's foot grounded there!? It looks very close but umpire Doctrove hasn't called for a replay! Surely he had to!
carefully defended this time, no alarms
well it looks as though Wright might just be have been out there, poor call from the umpire, Wright gets a single here, pushing into space
Morgan cuts to backward point for a single
Wright pushes forward and drives firmly towards the backward point boundary
studious defence to finish the over
starts the new spell with a full toss that is clipped very nicely towards deep midwicket for a couple
inside-edged defence runs away for a single into the leg side
touch short, Morgan rocks back to cut but picks out point
similar ball, similar shot and similar result
again Afridi allows Morgan to cut and this time it goes past the infield and Morgan collects a single
very good running from Wright here, drove crisply towards deep cover and scampers back for two
oh no! Asad Shafiq, who's normally a good fielder has been done by the spin on Morgan's sliced drive, turned past the hands and went through to the deep point boundary
follows up the gifted boundary with a single
carefully defended off the front foot
another very studious defence
Wright gets everything behind another defensive block
good batting from Wright, not doing anything silly
short ball down the leg side to start a new spell from Razzaq and Morgan whips a pull shot down to fine leg
touch of wobble in the air for Razzaq and Wright mistimes his attempted cut shot
this swings in and clips the pads, dribbling down the leg side to a single
full and Morgan drives cleanly to long-off
Razzaq feeds Wright's hitting arc outside off and the swish is timed nicely but straight to point
top shot! Beautiful shot from Wright, Razzaq serves it full and Wright punched a drive straight back past the bowler for four
Morgan's gifted his wicket away! Nothing delivery on leg stump and Morgan flicked it straight to deep square leg, great bonus for Pakistan and they are right back in the game now!
this pitches and zips away off the wicket past Bresnan's outside edge, suddenly plenty of chat from the Pakistan fielders
swing and a miss from Bresnan, trying to drive outside off stump, Umar Akmal spills the take behind the stumps, learning perfectly from his elder brother
Gul strikes, off stump cartwheeling! What a strike! Pitched and came back in, bursting through the defences to send off stump flying out the ground!
great take from Umar Akmal flying down the leg side, full and clips the pads, Umar collects and plenty of chat out there, Pakistan fired up!
great delivery, quick and swinging into Broad who manages to jab a bat down just in time
well, poor tactics this, Broad is given a run, pushing to long-on for a single
well, poor tactics this, Broad is given a run, pushing to long-on for a single
good from Wright, dropping it into the off side and hurrying off for a single
full toss, not a great ball and Broad bunts it to long-on for one
good fielding at extra cover, saves a couple from Wright's well-timed drive
Wright drives firmly again but picks out the fielder at extra cover again
good shot this, Broad whipping off his pads in front of midwicket for a single
what a delivery this is, angling in and swinging away past Wright's outside edge, Umar Akmal collects very cleanly behind the stumps
England obviously don't need to hurry here so Wright is content to be very careful against Gul
Wright drops it into the leg side and sets off for one, Broad and Gul have a mini-collision midpitch but doesn't look too dramatic
gone! Gul cleans Broad up to give him a five-for! What a delivery! Full and swinging in and flattening middle stump! Pakistan nearing victory now!
big roar from the crowd as Gul runs in but Swann's defence is solid
Wright swishes a powerful drive to long-off for a single
Swann very carefully defends back to the bowler
touch of spin gets the outside edge and runs towards short third man
quicker ball, yorker length, Swann does well to dig this out
another studious defence into the off side
wild swing from Swann outside off to finish the over
beaten outside off! Wright swishes and misses
good running gets Wright a couple here, he chops to Razzaq on the third man boundary and sets off very quickly
calmly defended back to the bowler, three more Gul deliveries to survive
inswinging yorker that Wright just manages to squeeze into the leg side for a single to bring Swann on strike
ooh, this is either play and miss or a very fine leave as Swann draws his bat inside the line

gone! Gul strikes with the last ball of his spell to remove Swann! That's a career-best for Gul! Not a great delivery but Pakistan won't care, full half-volley that Swann stroked straight to Afridi at short extra cover. What a sensational spell of bowling and it's gone a long, long way to giving Pakistani fans some much-needed joy!
Wright collects a single driving without much timing down the ground
Anderson defends and it runs down to short third man
another edgy, careful defence
pushed back down the pitch, Afridi tumbles to field
given a touch of air, skews off an inside edge through the vacant midwicket for a single
sliced!... but safe! Wright skips down the wicket and has a big heave-ho, getting a thick outside edge that loops safely - with shots like that surely it's time for the Powerplay!?
tucked round the corner to short fine leg, no run there
Wright gives himself room outside leg, but doesn't try anything expansive as Ajmal follows him, worked around the corner for a single
Anderson rocks forward to defend
quicker, much quicker from Ajmal, outside off stump and Anderson leaves alone
bit of width here and Anderson unfurls an excellent cut shot, picking up a couple to deep point
Anderson forward to defend, survives another Ajmal over and whether they like it or not, now is indeed the Powerplay
good delivery first up, zipping into Wright who gets in a tangle and the ball trickles back off his thigh towards the stumps and he hurriedly boots it out of harm's way
good bowling here, Wright edges outside leg stump but Razzaq follows him and it comes off the body for single
ooh, this might persuade them to bring a slip into place, swinging away past Anderson's dangling outside edge

Razzaq strikes! Stumps flying and Pakistan have won! Fielders jumping around everywhere, what a result! What a performance, Pakistan love it at The Oval! England looked as good as home while Morgan and Wright were together but then Umar Gul was gifted Morgan's wicket and flattened England's lower order.
